description:
If I could give 6 stars, I so would! This special gem is surprisingly not too crowded on the weekdays (can't speak for weekends); my boyfriend and I walked in around 7:00pm on a Wednesday night and got seated right away.

Location: Divisadero Street between Fulton and McAllister. It's a cute, vibrant street with plenty of restaurants and cafes. We got lucky with a parking spot around the corner on Fulton Street.

Atmosphere: Dimly lit but with enough lighting to see the menu. I think it would be a great date spot, if you don't mind sharing food!

Food: This is where all the place gets all the stars! The pizza is UNBEATABLE and they offer deep dish crust or thin crust. I've wanted to relive my Chicago deep dish memories for so long, but so few places outside of the area can do it well. Lo and behold, this place is not one of those few! My boyfriend and I shared the 9" deep dish pizza with half margherita plus and half little star. The portion was just enough for the both of us -- the 9" has 6 slices and I left feeling pretty full but didn't feel like I had to stuff myself to finish it. It is quite a bit of a wait for the deep dish (~20 mins), but I assure you it is worth it. The crust is made of cornmeal, so it added a really nice texture that had the perfect amount of crisp and allowed us to eat the pizza cleanly with a fork and knife! (It was pretty easy to cut through the crust) I prefer pizzas with more tomato sauce and this did the trick -- it was also really flavorful with the garlic, but it also wasn't soggy. The little star was my favorite of the two, because it had ricotta cheese and spinach -- one of my favorite combinations in pizza. But the margherita was also a solid choice. I'd highly recommend both!
author: Lillian T.

description:
Great pizza. Great staff. Cool atmosphere. Glad we stopped in on a whim. 
I like the space; it's intimate but not intimidating like some smaller spots can feel.
They had a great lunch special. 
Honestly, just pleasantly surprised at how great everything was since we just kinda stumbled in, not knowing what to expect.
author: Helene S.

description:
Came here on a Sunday before opening at 3pm and were the first ones in! There wasn't a line or anything at 3pm, but by 4:15pm the restaurant was packed. 

Atmosphere // dimly lit and intimate, families and their kids, a few couples and some solo eaters 

Service // very friendly and attentive 

Food // 
-get the garlic cheese bread it's amazing and has the option to add on artichoke hearts- yummm!

-for pizza, we went deep dish style with the meteor 2.0 and roasted corn. We liked the meteor 2.0 more because of the tomato sauce which was delish. This deep dish pizza is unique because they have cornmeal crust! It's different but not my favorite, because I'm such a huge fan of chewy bread. 

Overall // not sure if this pizza is for me but it is pretty delicious and I would recommend giving it a try at least once!
author: Emily T.

description:
Walking four blocks from our hotel
Our toddler's hissy fits were hell!
Looking for a Mexican restaurant,
We realized we no longer want
When we found Little Star
We decided not to go far.
There wasn't much of a long wait. 
For a Saturday night, that was great!

They rushed our toddler's sausage & cheese.
It sure put ALL of us at ease!
She enjoyed her pie.
If she hadn't, I would die.
Waited long for our deep dish classic,
It's okay since there was cool music.
Sausage in the pizza was delicious,
I was surprised it didn't make me nauseous
Mushrooms! Green Bell Peppers! Onions!
Totally loved it! Thanks in millions!

Our toddler deserved a treat
Walking four blocks with her little feet!
They ran out of strawberry gelato 
Or was it pistachio?!?
Instead they had cookie supreme 
I saw my daughter's eyes gleam.
They insisted it was a gelato
However, I am no mofo
It was way too creamy
Were they high and dreamy?!?
author: Jen C.

description: Little Star has reliably excellent pizza. I gave it five stars (in my head) before I ate here a dozen times. Now it's closer to normal-great (four stars) because I just expect all pizza to be this good all the time, and b/c Divisadero corridor is now a food Mecca with lots of fun choices besides just pizza. Wings are spot on, too. Service is often messy. The waiting area is too small. The reservations system makes up for it by cycling people through quickly.
author: Morris R.

description:
Came here on a Friday night at 9pm or so (a bit on the late side), but there was still a wait which is crazy to me.  

We ordered the deep dish (which takes a bit longer), but super worth it because it was delicious. It was the last bits of beer week so having pizza with beer was perfect. This is the best pizza I've had in awhile and its definitely worth it.

Atmosphere: 4/5 (a bit small and a little loud, but overall very comfy and enjoyable)
Food and drink: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Overall Experience: 5/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
For some reason, I mentioned being interested in pizza this weekend. I got held to my statement, so Little Star Pizza it was.

We got the half and half deep dish-- half old school with pepperoni, olives, and onions, and half little star, which is a combo with spinach and mushrooms.

It arrived piping hot. The top was smothered in fresh-tasting diced and sorta wilted tomatoes, which made it a bit hard to tell the difference between the two flavors. I liked the cheese on this-- not that pungent, but perfectly stringy and made you feel like they were using real ingredients. The dough was super soft and the cornmeal crust was a nice change of scenery-- a bit crunchy for my tastes, with slight grittiness from the cornmeal. A 9" would be sufficient for two moderately hungry people.

As with all other foods, I tend to eat my layers separately so I can actually taste the ingredients. All were high quality. There was a decent amount of toppings on this. A 3.75/5 for me.
author: Nicole H.

description:
We ordered via Caviar the "classic" deep dish and the BBQ chicken thin crust. The pizza travels great and came super quickly (thanks Caviar).

The pizza was great, my only complaint is that the BBQ chicken pizza crust got SO hard I thought I'd lose a tooth. But on the other hand, the deep dish was one of the tastiest I've had in a long time, so I can say it was definitely worth it. It had the perfect amount of sauce (sometimes deep dish has too much), and the crust was the smallest bit crispy on the bottom, but just doughy/squishy enough to be super satisfying texture-wise. Overall, amazing. 

Additionally, I would like to point out that the ranch here is bomb.com. Everything you could want and more: plentiful, runny and fresh. I'd come back just for the ranch.
author: Jamie J.

description: This place was A-Ok. Bottom line, I wouldn't wait in line for this, and I wouldn't wait 40 minutes for my pizza to come after I order. The pizza tasted better the day after when I reheated it the day after, but the cheese was just so hard and dense when we ate it at the restaurant.
author: Brandon L.

description: Service was meh, nothing special...not very attentive. But I'm not here for the service, I'm here for the food! Thin crust - white pizza, pretty damn good! Nothing short of the veggies on top, good amount of garlic and not heavy at all. Lots of olive oil rolling down the sleeves but it's ok. Can't wait to come back and try the deep dish next time.
author: Teresa P.

description:
I used to like getting the meteor deep dish, but I found that I enjoy the thin crust even more! The dough for the thin crust is the same as what is used for the deep dish, so it has the same unique, delicious taste. I especially recommend the thin crust because instead of feeling stuffed after one slice (like for the deep dish), you can keep eating more slices. The crust also has a nice crunch to it.

For appetizers, I highly recommend the chicken wings! I like that they are a dry rub, so there is no extra sauce to get all over your face. They are small and easy to eat.
author: Andrea T.

description: I ordered Brass Monkey  via cavier. This is a legit Chicago style pizza with right amount Mariana sauce and friend onion within it is bonus.
author: Ash M.

description:
I ordered to go from here, so I can't say much about the restaurant, but the people I spoke to on the phone and when I got there were both very friendly. It is a very small restaurant, but they have a nice sign out front so you know where to find it.

I ordered deep dish from here because it seems to be what they were known for. I have a very deep love for deep dish, so I was interested in seeing their take on it.

I got the small deep dish with bacon, italian sausage, and goat cheese. The small was enough for me eat on for a couple of days. The crust didn't get soggy because of the toppings and had a nice crunch. The tomato sauce  flavored nicely and there wasn't too much so it didn't override all of the toppings I added. I wish I had the stomach to finish it in one sitting. I would like to come back here when I am in San Francisco again to try one of their specialty pizzas.
author: Alanna T.

description:
First Impression: Already excited to eat this food because of the pictures I saw on Yelp! lol 

Food: Chicago style deep dish pizza  The PIZZA was so FLUFFY! Extremely thick, like extra cheesy ! It was my first time trying Chicago Style pizza and it was so worth it !! 

Service:  Excellent  Friendly ‍

Details: The place isn't that big, but it gets pretty full.'
author: Steph S.

description: Terrific pizza place. Little Star is really good; indeed, I dare to say that this is the best pizza in San Francisco. Professional and friendly staff all year around to match the quality of the food. Nice atmosphere for families and young people. I am happy my friends and I stopped in on a whim before going to a bar to watch the Warriors game. I got the Meteor 2.0 and Roasted Corn Deep Dish Pizza and it was delicious, not to mention the cornmeal crust that makes this pizza unique and different from any other pizza. Happy I made it to this place, I was delighted by such a flavorful meal. I'll be back for more.
author: Arnold H.

description: Total 5 Star. Not a 4 Star. If yelp was 10 star reviews I would give it a 9. Rookie score. Delicious corn meal crust. Quality toppings. Low grease.  Negatives. Parking can be a b.  I ended up illegally parking to get my food.  Man I can close my eyes and taste this pizza. Delicious pie. Bonus round:  The staff are so friendly and helpful. Took 15 minutes to have the pizza ready. Great place.
author: Brett H.

description: Great deep dish pizza. In the restaurant the vibe is dark and intimate, with candles on the tables. It's a great restaurant.
author: Neil S.

description: Amazing. First word that comes to mind when I think about this pizza. I ordered the large (16 inch I think) combo style pizza to go,which only took about 20-30 minutes of waiting inside the restaurant. To go orders are held in the back counter of the restaurant, which is moderately sized inside. The ingredients were fantastically fresh. At first glance, the pizza could have looked like a photogenic Costco pizza. But once you begin eating, you'll realize that it's 100x better. If I'm in the area again, I'd definitely consider coming back and trying a different variety of pizza!
author: Kristi H.

description:
Since last week we went to Blue Line, I decided to check out Little Star to compare. I arrived around 7pm and catch the all day happy hour on Tuesday! We took advantage by ordering garlic bread, wings and a couple drinks.

The garlic bread was on point. Basically the size of a personal pizza. The wings were spicy and delicious. Honestly I think I overdid it with the appetizers cause I was nearly full. It was so good.

We ordered a small deep dish Meateor 2.0 and all though it was small in size, it was more than enough.

I know I've been a big fan of Patxi's for many years, but Little Star was really good. I asked then for honey to top it off and it was bomb.com. Big fan over here. It was cheesy, piled with tomatoes and the sauce was delicious. The sausage was really tasty, but I couldn't really find or taste the pepperoni.

The only con I had was how small the pizza actually is. If it weren't for the appetizers, I would have eaten a small by myself easily. I would def recommend getting a large if you don't plan on ordering anything else.
author: Maria E.

description:
My husband and I came here for lunch on Saturday! it is definitely a hole in the wall type of place. Wooden tables inside, a bit dark. Clean and friendly environment. 
We were seated quickly and given our menus! 
We had ordered the breadsticks for appetizers, and the breadsticks were soooooo good! delicious! Then we ordered a small meaty pizza that was good as well! however next time I think I would probably like to try another one. 

They didn't have any ranch which was a bummer and I was sad! (that's why i'm giving a 4 star)  and my husband told me to get over it because it masks the taste the pizza so whatever haha. I LOVE their rootbeer, they give you a nice frozen glass, with a proper rootbeer bottle! and I love their dark brown straws. Seriously the best rootbeer I have ever had. 

Their small is 6 slices, so if there is two of you or even 3 it is good enough size, if you order deep dish they are quite filling! 

The customer service was good. 
Bathrooms were clean, however no toilet seat covers, so..squat it like it's hot! 

Overall, loved the food. Would defiantly go again!
author: Jasmit D.

description:
We chanced upon Little Star Pizza thanks to Yelp. This place definitely deserves its stars. 

We tried the Meateor 2.0 with a thin crust. The meat and the rest of the ingredients were delicious. The crust was just so thin that it served as a plate for the rest of the ingredients. The crust was not crunchy but firm. I am really impressed with the pizza. 

The ambience is cool. A jukebox in one corner, a few arcade machines around, and some cool artwork on the walls. Pretty eclectic and artistic vibe. 

Basically, this is a great pizza joint. Quite easily the best pizza I had in SF. It is best suited for a casual night out.
author: Doruk B.

description: Bbq pizza thin crust and garlic bread was 10/10!!!!! Didn't really enjoy the deep dish though... so 4/5 :)
author: Jackie C.

description:
Delicious thin and thick pies. We were sat down quickly on a Thursday night, even though it was pretty crowded. 

We ordered 2 pizzas:

- Margherita - we chose the thin crust. Well done  
- Pollo - chicken in a deep dish and it tasted grand after eating the simple Margherita  

There were whole garlic pieces (yes!) and the cheese stretches like no other. The deep dish takes about 20-30 min to cook but that's how much restaurants take to make food at times anyway. We also had a spring salad before the pizza to balance it with more fiber. They also have craft beers.
author: Iris Y.

description: During my trip to SF, I saw this place had a good rating,  but was skeptical cause I've been disappointed by deep dish pizzas everywhere besides Chicago and a few. Little star wasn't one of them. The crust was made of cornmeal, I think. Tasted a bit different but delicious. The cheese and sauce was great as well.
author: Vibhor S.

description:
Delicious pizza, excellent craft beers and friendly service. A special shout out to Grace , the hostess, who handled the large Saturday night crowd with warmth and grace! 

We had the thin crust roasted corn pizza, which was flavorful and crisp. We also tried the deep dish margarita pizza, which was more traditional but not greasy or heavy, as many deep dish pizzas tend to be. 

The only downside is that it is hard to park in this neighborhood, but it is worth spending time hunting for a place to park. Will definitely be back!
author: Susan J.

description:
This pizza is bomb. 

I got: Large BYO Thin Cheese Pizza w/ pepperoni & pineapple (yes, I'm one of those people. Let's move on) - the thin pizza is SUPER thin, but it works! The dough is really fresh, and the perfect balance of chewy, crispy, and savory.

The tomato sauce portion was restrained (not sloppy) and was just the right amount of tart, with visible pieces of actual tomato throughout. The pepperoni was crispy and the cheese was spread both under and over the pepperoni, which was a surprising and delicious detail.

Overall, this pizza is really fresh, savory without being greasy, and really well-priced for SF & the portion/quality.
author: Ally H.

description:
Let me start off by saying customer service was great. 
Pizza was bomb! You can choose your toppings if you want to build your own pizza. 
I got 12inch pizza..half waa bbq chicken and half "classic" 
The bbq chicken one was soo good. You can taste the caramelized red onions with a hint of sweetness from pineapple and crunchy bacon and cheese just melts in your mouth 
They also have a small bar with a lot of beer options
author: Liz D.

description: Excellent place to grab a pizza. I was alone and my wait staff was very helpful in helping me decipher which pizza to get and what was on it and how large.  They had a special, but it wasn't on their menu.  I had some type of veggies and it was out of this world.  You won't regret coming here
author: Denise G.

description:
Cold, hard, old, over seasoned pizza and tiny dried wings. The pizza was so hard it felt like we were going to break our teeth trying to chew it. You can tell that whoever made it didn't let the dough rise at all. Plus since it was pre-made earlier and they had to reheated it, it got even harder. Worst Pizza we have received in the city. Totally rip off.

Going to stick with G in Inner Richmond for better quality.
author: Alice P.

description: Yes, amazing. Probably one of the best pizzas I've had...ever. My boyfriend and I aren't huge deep dish fans, so we got the pollo on thin crust. Bacon, chicken, caramelized red onions, brie cheese and spinach. Wow. It came super quick, so if you don't feel like waiting, thin crust is the way to go. We had two leftover slices for lunch the next day - even better extra crispy. The tomato sauce is really, really good. I now understand the hype. On a Saturday night, definitely add your name to the online waitlist 30 - 40 mins before you plan to eat.
author: Dana J.

description: Best pizza I have ever had, I ordered the little star pizza deep dish and the white pizza. The little star the best I ever had, but the white pizza was a bit too salty for me. But overall very good.
author: Tiara C.

description: We ordered barbeque chicken pizza. We were surprised to see such a high rating for this place in the beginning. But its totally worth it!
author: Arifulla S.

description:
Pizza review. 

Ordered:
Deep dish (fresh mozz, roasted garlic, pepperoni, anchovies)

Crust - 5 - Cornmeal crust
Toppings - 4
Taste - 5

Overall, best deep dish in the city. "As good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
I can not, not give this place 5 stars. I'd be a freaking liar. 

If and when I crave pizza and I find myself in beautiful San Francisco, Little Star is my place. 

Their deep dish is soooooo good. Usually get it with sausage and pepperoni and it never disappoints. 

With a beer in one hand and a fork in the other (yeah you need a knife and fork) you'll be satisfied throughout your entire experience here.
author: Rosa P.

description:
This review is for the gluten free pizza only. Solid pizza... I got the Little Star with spinach, onion, garlic etc. Even though the menu said DD only they made it for me on GF crust. The toppings were high quality and delicious. They mentioned this was the most popular pizza. The gluten free crust was just ok...definitely not the best I've ever had. Tony's GF pizza is for sure better. BUT this pizza still hit the spot and when you can't get all the way to North Beach this is still a solid choice. Even my non-gf husband and brother enjoyed the pizza a lot!

I have Celiac so I always check on the cross contamination situation. They use the same oven for all pizzas but assured me they try to keep everything separate and use a cooking sheet under the gf pizza in the oven. I didn't get sick. 

Also, I ordered this pizza to go (for pick up), and it was ready as soon as my husband walked in the door to get it! I literally thought he may have stolen the pizza he walked out so fast ;)
author: Christina C.

description:
A friend and I were craving pizza one day, and I live near Little Star but hadn't been, so I suggested it. I'm not a fan of deep dish, so we compromised and got a large, thin pie with pepperoni and roasted garlic. My friend went to pick it up, where it was hot and waiting! We dove in and it was amazing. The crust is thin, so if you like New York-style pizza, this will make your belly happy. The roasted garlic came as full cloves (rather than minced) so just take note! 

I will definitely be back.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Great pizza, great appetizers, and great happy hour rate on beers ($5 for craft brews until 6:30pm W-F). 

Appetizers: Chicken wings and garlic bread are delicious. Pizza: The Italian (deep dish) and the Pollo (gluten free) are both tasty. 

Depending on the time you go, the wait can be long, but worth the wait. FYI: They won't seat you until a majority of your party arrives.
author: Enrique F.

description: Really good deep dish. Dang! We ordered a medium veggie and the pizza arrived at our table hot and crispy. Keep in mind our taste buds are wired for deep dish from Chicago and so we had really high expectations. Little star pizza delivered! Can't wait to visit once I am back in San Francisco.
author: Jay S.

description:
BEST PIZZA ON THE PLANET.

No long, flowery review. Let's make it short and sweet.  I've been to 26 countries and lived in five of them, as well as 7 different states.  This is without question the best pizza I've ever had. Try it.  

Try it soon.  

You should probably get going.  I said to try it a full 3 seconds ago.
author: John B.

description:
Being from Chicago, I can be quite the deep-dish snob. 

However, I recently decided to try the deep dish at Little Star Pizza after my roommates convinced me it was "the best in SF". Well, they were right. The Cornmeal Crust was delicious and perfectly crumbly, the cheese was tasty and melted just right and the sauce was solid. Additionally, I was not offended by the price! Not too bad for SF. I will definitely be hitting up Little Star again in the future.
author: Katie C.

description:
We had a large order with Little Star for a work event. We ordered
a Thin Margherita plus, a deep dish little star, thin cheese, thin BBQ chicken, a thin meateor 2.0, wings, and mixed salad. For 25 people we had more than enough food. We could have actually gone with another  margherita pizza instead of the cheese since it was such a hit. 

The staff were friendly and super helpful when we ordered. I spoke with the owner and he really knew exactly how much we should get! It was perfect. It was all fresh and delicious. We'll order through little star again.
author: Michelle N.

description: This pizza spot is without a doubt one of the best pizzerias that I've been to. I had the half Margarita and half Yellow Squash pizza. The ingredients are fresh and very tasty. Any time I'm in SF, I'll be sure to stop by this place.
author: Carlos S.

description:
Yelp reviews did not disappoint on this one! Came here for dinner tonight and wasn't sure at first. Looks from the outside are deceiving. They're doing construction on the street so it's a bit hidden, but find street parking and give it a try. It's worth the trouble! 

I wish I knew our servers name. She was super sweet and helpful. I should note that we were here at about 6 on a Monday night and there was no wait and it was super family friendly. We took our two kiddos there and they loved their "mini pizzas". Monday is happy hour all day and kids pizzas are $4 or free with a large pizza. They also have some specials on wine and appetizers. We ordered the gluten free pizza ($2/more and only comes in medium) and it was perfect for my husband and I to share (and we both have decent appetites)! You can half the specialty pizzas for $1/more so he got the bbq chicken and I got the Brussels sprouts, both without cheese. The flavors were great and the gf crust was good, as long as you are okay with a crispy, cracker like crust (which we are)! We also tried the kale appetizer and it was delicious. Definitely recommend this place!!! We'll be back!
author: Nikki R.

description: Great pizza! We got the deep dish pollo and it was delicious :) reasonable price for what it is. they do wait to sit you until everyone in your party is there. Overall great service.
author: Sarah B.

description:
One of the few deep dish places in the city. (Pro: parking is plentiful on a Monday evening) I like the variety of the menu and the happy hour specials - all night Monday/Tuesday and until 6:30PM W-F. I came here on a Monday night at 6:30PM with a few tables still available. Note that they don't seat you until most of your party is there so make sure your friends are on time! ... but we ended up opting to sit at the bar because the Warriors game was playing.

For our party of 3 we shared a Large deep dish pizza - half Little Star and half Pollo (Little Star dominates for sure), kale salad and spicy chicken wings. The Little Star slices were the star of my meal, hands down. The cheese was so gooey and went on and on when you first bite into the slice (sign of a well cheesed-up pizza imo)

Be cautious of the pizza size you order because they come in generous portions! We easily could've downsized to a Small pizza since we ordered apps. We ended up having 40% of the pie as leftover!

Overall, we enjoyed the meal but will venture out to discover other deep dish spots in the city before making our way back to this spot
author: Carissa G.

description: This was my first deep dish pizza experience, and it was amazing! Went with some pals and ordered an original 12 inch deep dish pizza. For appetizers we split the caprese salad and chicken wings, both were delicious! The wings had bite to them. We ended the night with a warm brownie and mint chip ice cream. This place has a great atmosphere too!
author: Samantha B.

description:
Came here for lunch after we visited the painted ladies! Ordered a large classic deep dish pizza and it was stellar. No wonder why there are so many good reviews for this place. The pizza is packed with filling and I love how the sausages come in big chunks. One slice was already filling. My bf and I had to take half of the pizza to go, so if it's only two people, a small is more than enough. 

Not too many places in SF that do deep dish but this place has got it right. If only they had another location in SF more convenient, I'd be having this all the time.
author: Annie H.

description:
As much as I feel bad for giving 3 stars, this pizza is not just for me. Probably because I like Italian pizza, and I have been to awesome pizza restaurants before (Il Casaro is my favorite by far!).

We tried both thin crust and deep dish. I don't like deep dish pizza, too heavy and cracker like crust. I really don't understand this pizza style.
As for thin crust, it was just mediocre.

Ok the goods.. you can get added to the waitlist from restaurant's website, loved it! The service is friendly, and the ambiance is cool with arcade games.

Try this place if you like Deep dish and stuff, don't go if you like real Italian pizza.
author: Merve A.

description: I am a native SF and never had the chance to try Little Star but heard it's one of the best pizza's in the Bay Area.  It was good but not sure if I'd rate it as one of the best pizza places?  Luckily we went early so we did not have to wait as we've heard there usually is a line.  Maybe it's the pizza we ordered?  We ordered Deep Dish BBQ Chicken and a Thin Crust Italian Combo.  I usually like thick crust but the crust was hard and I usually never leave a pizza crust, but could not really eat it.  I ended up liking Little Star's thin crust more than the thick?  We waited 20 minutes for the thick crust and I was just not impressed with it.  Not sure if I need to try Little Star again but again it was good and not bad pizza.
author: Em D.

description: Yes! Love--cornbread like crust, smart toppings layering, fresh tasting sauce, not too greasy or overly flavored. Good textures and delicious! I didnt enjoy the cheese only/old school one as much as the other flavor though! ( too much cheese)
author: Lydia Z.

description: I was excited about this place because of the amazing reviews about their deep dish pizza. I got the meateor 2.0 and a margarita pizza both large and deep dish. Both were delicious and more than enough food for 4 people. We probably could have gotten the size small. But leftovers for later is always nice. I can't say it is better than Chicago DD pizza, but it was nice to try something new. Personal preference, I would ask for less sauce, but everyone in my group loved all the pizza so this is def a place to check out if you are in SF and are craving some specialty pizza.
author: Megan O.

description: I've been looking for a solid tomato sauce for quite some time in California. And being a Chicago style pizza fan I can unapologetically recommend Little Star Pizza.  If you are on the hunt for some good zesty, chunky, crunchy deep dish pizza. In a town where ethic food is king it's nice to sit back with friend and family and share a slice off the ole pie and remiss of Chi-Town!
author: Andrew T.

description:
My first time coming to Little Star even though I had heard plenty of good things beforehand. Interesting back story to the Little Star Pizza "chain" as apparently they are not all the same with the Valencia and Albany locations under a different owner.

As for this restaurant we ordered the Meteor 2.0 deep dish pizza along with an appetizer of roasted kale. I was impressed with the kale - it was fresh and crunchy and flavorful as well as not overly salty. It was a good prelude to the pizza itself. I usually prefer thin crust to deep dish pizzas as I find many deep dishes to be too oily as well as over saturated with sauce. Neither was applicable to Little Star's pizza as it was honestly one of the tastiest pizzas I have ever had in the Bay Area. Service was friendly and timely and the ambience was a nice small neighborhood vibe that makes you feel good about being in the city.

First timer but soon not to be. Recommended.
author: Mike G.

description: So good so good!! One of best pizza and appetizers I had in my life. This place was super crowded and had to wait quite a bit to get food. Yet, I am very happy that I tried this place. Wish I could go back sometime soon!
author: Amanda K.

description: Got takeout pizza from here. Got a deep dish because that seems to be what this place is known for and a thin crust. The pizzas are definitely fresh, tasty and good quality. It's not the best I've had but it's a good pizzeria if you are in the area.
author: Ruchi M.

description: I've never actually eaten here but I've had take out and delivery (through DoorDash) a few times. This is some of my favorite pizza in SF. It's deep dish but the cornmeal crust really sets it apart, its crunchy on the outside and soft inside and really really good. I like to order it with meatballs (delicious) and/or ricotta (small dollops on each slice so don't expect it to melt into the pizza like ricotta often does). The wings are pretty good although fairly spicy and the salads and other items are alright. But the real star (no pun intended) here is the pizza so definitely order that. They do a good job of packaging it for take out and delivery so it stays hot and doesn't get soggy which is an added plus. Prices are perhaps slightly higher than other pizza joints but each slice is pretty filling and the ingredient quality seems high. Definitely 5 stars from me.
author: Seema U.

description:
If, like me, you'd thought deep dish pizza was a redundant, unnecessarily carb-laden affair full of unnecessary filler, then prepare to have your perspectives radically altered by Little Star's pizza, which has spawned all sorts of sister restaurants (or knockoffs, depending on how you see it) throughout the Bay Area.

Quite simply, it's the amazing cornmeal crust that makes the entire pizza here - regardless of which toppings you get. This place is perpetually mobbed, so I got a little star (spinach blended with ricotta, feta, mushroom, onion, and fresh garlic) pizza to go. By the time I could dig into it, it was already cold, yet somehow this didn't dampen my enjoyment a bit. I just heated it up in the microwave, and even the portions I couldn't finish made for a great lunch the following day. 

Mmmm, that crust. And the toppings - when finally warmed up - were quite pleasant to go along with it. My mouth is watering just thinking about it, so I might very well go there again soon. Very soon.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I'm a toppings person. I eat pizza because I can load it up with all my favorite toppings. I order thin crust because there's less crust to eat. So it was definitely a surprise when I was craving more of that delicious cornmeal crust! It was the MOST amazing deep dish crust I've ever had!

I took one star off because they fell short with the toppings. It was hard to find in their sauce. And I also ordered the Brownie with strawberry gelato for dessert, but the brownie was kinda burnt...

Pro tip! If you have 3 hungry people, don't get the small. It was DEFINITELY not enough for us.

They also served a complimentary glass of bubbly to all the women in honor of International Women's Day!
author: Athena C.

description:
Some of the best deep dish pizza I have had, especially on the west coast. The service was fantastic even for our big group and we really appreciated everything. 

We had three pizzas and some garlic bread and while I don't remember which ones we got, everything was delicious. I will be back and hungry for more.
author: Andrew V.

description:
My boyfriend and I just happen to stop by here after a comedy show we saw in SF and ordered a Margherita pizza to go. We waited inside while our order was being made and played games on their arcade. Food was ready quick! 

We took it back to our hotel and smashed!! Lol  One of the best versions of margherita pizza we have had in a while. There was roasted garlic cloves added which were so delicious! The pizza was so yummy, probably didn't hurt that we were literally starving! But I would without a doubt recommend this place and I would def come back when I am in the area with a hankering for some pizza!
author: Tiff S.

description:
Super family friendly, good service and KILLER FOOD makes for an awesome combo any night of the week. 

Decided to come here for an early dinner tonight with my family. Was stoked to see that they had happy hour food and drink specials until 6:30p. Woot woot! 

We started our meal with some appetizers off of the weekday happy hour menu. The caprese salad was your typical sliced tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, basil chiffonade, and olive oil and balsamic vinegar--delicious and definitely didn't disappoint. I ordered one order of the roasted kale then snuck in a second order before happy hour was up because it was THAT GOOD. I highly recommend it. You simply can't go wrong with big pieces of kale topped with sprinkle of Parmesan and feta, roasted to perfection and topped with fresh lemon wedge for you to finish off at your table. 

For our meal, we had the portobello pie deep dish pizza with tomato sauce. Crust was crispy and not crazy thick which I love because then you can really taste the toppings instead of every bite just being a mouthful of doughy crust. The ratio or crust to sauce to toppings and cheese was perfection! Sauce was very balanced between tart and sweet. Getting the big chunks of flavorful portobello was the best though. I normally like sausage or some type of meat on my pizza but this really didn't need it. Pizza also came out piping hot which made me really happy because last time I had deep dish pizza across town at another pizza place, my pie came out cold and crust was doughy like it wasn't fully cooked through. No such nonsense at Little Star! No wonder these guys have a 4.5 stars rating out of over 2500 Yelp reviews! 

For those of you with kiddos, little ones 10 and under get a free mini pizza during happy hour with order of a regular pizza for the grown ups. What a deal, right? Just make sure they don't sit you close to the door because as soon as anyone comes in, a bunch of cold air blows in and can be unpleasant when the temp gets below 60 outside.
author: Betty R.

description:
Usually pizza is probably one of the last things on my list I crave or want to go out for because pizza will always be pizza and I prefer costco pizza as it does the job for me. I guess I'm just not a pizza snob. But my girlfriend and I were going to see a concert at the Independent down the street and yelping a place closeby for dinner, we saw this place have a ton of reviews and a really good rating.. so that piqued our curiosity.

This place is tiny, so be prepared to wait at least 20-30 mins for a table. We put our name down and the hostess told us we could pre-order a deep dish while we wait because deep dish can take up to 30+ mins to make. How convenient! They also have thin crust option available for some topping choices. We decided on their small size classic deep dish and ordered buffalo wings as an appetizer. I highly recommend the trying the deep dish as the filling of the deep dish outweighs the crust by a LOT, which is why I think a lot of people like this place because you definitely get bang for your buck. The buffalo wings were really good too because they weren't as oily and saucy as most places do it. We left here feeling super full and even had two slices of deep dish we ended up tossing out because we couldn't finish it :( Definitely a good spot for deep dish in the city if that's what you want.
author: Kathleen S.

description: Awesome food and service!! pizza was amazing. deep dish was delicious, thin crust was great as well. wings were not the best, but still would get again!
author: Mark V.

description:
Little Star is a charming pizza place with a nice interior and friendly star. We went with a party of 9 for a birthday and they were happy to accommodate us. 
We ordered the burrata (delish), garlic bread (also delish) and two deep dishes, the Little Star and half white half Pollo. The pollo was by far my favorite in flavors, but the other two were a little lack luster. The crust was passable - not doughy like some places, but a little oily and over proofed. 
Overall I'd say the prices are great- bottle of wine, happy hour beers are all reasonably priced. The happy hour foods aren't that much of an improvement on the regular prices but hey, a discount is a discount.
author: Kim B.

description:
WORST experience in SF to date. 

* Hostess: Not helpful 
* Takeout Cashier: Did not acknowledge us or care to take our order 
* Bartender: Worst of them all. Not helpful or attentive. AFTER ordering our drinks, he then tells us we would have to leave the bar area and stand in the waiting area to consume our drinks, even though we ordered our food and were simply waiting for it to be ready. 

NOTE: all of this was AFTER the Little Star (Valencia location) messed up our order with a third party delivery service and never tried to correct the mistake. We attempted to ignore the mishap and give them a second chance. Mistake #2. 

**DO NOT GIVE LITTLE STAR YOUR BUSINESS**

Instead...treat yourself to something good :)

HAPPY HOLIDAYS!!
author: Gabe R.

description:
Came here on a Saturday afternoon and it was surprisingly slow, which was perfect. Pretty small restaurant with a largely forgettable design, but plenty of seating. I came mostly for their deep dish pizza, and if you're planning to do the same, keep in mind that it's a 20-30 minute wait. Our interaction with our waitress was very brief, but she was nice-- gave us space when we asked for more time to decide, reminded us of the option to split the flavors, and was all smiles.

I shared a small deep dish, half Classic and half Pollo ($1 extra charge for getting two different types) with my friend. I'd say we're pretty capable eaters, and the small was enough to make us super full! Needless to say, it was great. The cheese was chewy and stretchy, there's chunky tomato, and the crust is just right (firm enough to hold the toppings and not fall apart, but not hard and tough to eat). I also like how the edge of the crust is seasoned. If you're a pizza lover, it'd be hard to go wrong with this place! Would definitely recommend.
author: Vincent L.

description: I love their pizza!  It has great, buttery crust. The staff is friendly and courteous.  We are frequent out-of-towners who feel at home here. The beer is cold and the Pinot Noir is a nice compliment.
author: Patricia A.

description: Amazing. Come here for the deep dish. DEEP DISH!!! Pollo is my favorite. Do half and half if you want to try something else. But definitely get the POLLO.
author: Julian E.

description: From start to finish, great experience. The hostess greeted me with a big smile and was very kind. Since I was alone, I sat at the bar. The bartender was quite nice too and was careful to be attentive but not overly so. I arrived early in the evening so things were a little bit slow, but by the time I left the place was nearly full. I wanted to try the pizza but since I was by myself & I didn't want to take anything home, I ordered the Burrata appetizer. It was quite nice and the ripe tomatoes were the best I've had so far this summer. Now I know about this great little place that I've been curious about for a long time. Definitely will return.
author: M F.

description:
This might've been where I first tried deep-dish, but I can't really recall because it's been nearly a decade since I first came here! Despite that first trip not being so memorable, I came by again last night and LOVED IT. 

I honestly wasn't in the mood for pizza on a Sunday night, but my options were limited at 9pm.  A quick phone call confirmed that they took orders until closing at 9:30 so off we went! The place was pretty empty by that time, but service was still spectacular. It wasn't too hard to get anyone's attention and we quickly placed an order for a small (9" with 6 slices) Classic deep dish. The pizza smelled amazing, and more importantly, tasted amazing! The sauce smelled/tasted meaty and inviting. There were adequate amounts of meat/mushroom/cheese spread throughout, and the crust was perfectly crunchy and unburned. A small seems perfect to share for two people, my only concern was the uneven cutting... we had one tiny baby slice!   Dinner came out to just over $20 which really isn't bad for tasty deep dish! 

Just some other info: Deep dish pizzas typically take about 30 minutes to cook so don't come starving! Thin crust is also available, but come on, you can get that anywhere else. There's a good amount of 2 or 4 person tables available, I didn't see too many tables bigger than that but I'm sure stuff can be moved around. Finally, I'm definitely not a deep dish connoisseur, but I enjoyed this pizza more than the one deep dish I had in Chicago!
author: Christine L.

description: Really good pizza, ordered pick up and drove around the block five times to wait for it to be made. Lg izza two adults three children=gone! Busy  but worth it, btw not a local
author: Michael B.

description:
To all the pizza-lovers living in SF, put Little Star on your list of places to try! Their quality pizzas are not to be missed. My friends and I came here for dinner and started off with the wings, which were delicious. Actually some of the best wings I've ever had; they had a bit of a kick, but weren't too spicy and the flavor was great. For dinner, we got one thin crust and one deep dish pizza to share, and both were top notch! The thin crust pizza had a great ratio of sauce, cheese, and toppings and was just overall really tasty. The deep dish pizza came out next and, as the first deep dish pizza I've ever tried, it did not disappoint! The sauce in particular was very good. I didn't really know what to expect from a deep dish pizza, but trying it for the first time here set the bar pretty high! 
I would definitely recommend Little Star to pizza-people of any kind - they do both thin crust and deep dish equally well! And don't forget the wings :)
author: Alyx V.

description: Horrible service from the hostess. Rude and lied to us about a mistake they did with our reservation, instead of letting us know about the error.
author: Matias H.

description: the oizza was late and cold. the reatuarnat it's not their fault--talk to theirthird-party delivery!
author: Adair L.

description: I can't believe I haven't written a review for Little Star.  What cheapskate in their right mind would spend nearly $30 for a deep dish pizza? Me!  But the Classic was disappointing.  Get the now off menu, Mediterranean Chicken. One piece fills you up.  One piece with a salad is often split between hubby and myself.  Yum.  It is so good that when we return to our Ohio home,I have been known to fill the suitcase with pizza.  It freezes easily and travels well in one of those freezable bags.  Easy walk from Lower Pac.  I won't go anywhere else.
author: Vickie B.

description: Quaint place, great service, delicious root beer and amazing pizza. I had goat cheese, pineapple and sausage pizza and it was the greatest pizza ever.
author: Alison A.

description: Pretty good gluten free crust pizza at this place. My friends and I got takeout because she lives right across the street and we weren't in the mood to wait to sit at a table. We ordered some wings and pizza. They originally said the wings were gluten free, but at the end of our order they told us they were not. Everyone enjoyed their pizzas; I got the Brussels sprouts one and it was pretty good even without the cheese. I was disappointed that the wings weren't gluten free; they looked like they were though not that great... Guess I'll do with anchovies as my protein again next time!
author: Samira I.

description:
We got the Italian combo pizza and it was really delicious. We got some drinks while we waited for a table to open up. We ordered ahead so when we actually got to our table, all we had to do was wait for our pizza to arrive. The waiter was kind enough to let us know that our pizza wasn't in the oven. The manager gave us complimentary wings due to the inconvenience. I thought that was very thoughtful of him. According to one of the signs on the wall, the restaurant is Michelin guide recommended. The sauce was so delicious. I've never had a deep dish pizza that has a crispy crust on the bottom. I actually ate a slice like a regular slice of pizza! 

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!
author: Bernadette A.

description:
Pizzas are my favorites, So when I eat a good pizza, I just cannot deny it. Tasty pizza, good customer service but took quite some time to get my pizza on my table and then into my belly.
A little hint here: t's a good place to take a pizza lover such as I to... You would definitely win my heart, hahahahaha :D
author: Samson L.

description: Great example of a deep dish pizza!  Came here after leaving Dolores because I was craving pizza and not just any pizza, but deep dish and boy did it exceed expectations!  The sauce was amazing and the crust had the best cornmeal flavor!  Next time I visit SF I'll come straight here!
author: Maurice O.

description: Fast and good service. I recommend the the thin crust pizza, it is superb. We also had the classic thick crust but it was not my favorite. I expected doughy thick but it wasn't still good though
author: Carmen L.

description:
O M G this place is the bomb, but to be fair I have no prior experience to compare to. This is my first time ever trying deep dish pizza, so I didn't know what to expect. Friends and I came in on a Friday night for dinner, and luckily for us there was no wait! We were seated right away. 

The ambience is very hip and modern, with cute art on the walls and dimmer lighting. There are two sizes to choose from, 9" and 12". You can also build your own pizza too! But as amateurs, we just stuck to the menu. The waitress told us about a special, thin crust pizza with bacon, bell peppers, and corn. We ordered that and the classic deep dish. 

For a party of 4, one 9" thin crust and one 9" deep dish was plenty! The waitress said it would be about 15 mins for the special and 30 mins for the deep dish, appreciated the heads up! The thin crust special was really good, very thin crust yet not soggy in the least bit, but the star of the night was definitely the deep dish! Perfectly crunchy and flakey crust, without a hint of sogginess and loaded to the top with sauce and toppings. 

That deep dish pizza had me dreaming about it, I already want to drive all the way back to get some more! I'll never eat a regular pizza again.
author: Veronica D.

description:
Deep dish pizza is a must. I also enjoyed the wings and salad. They offer Champ cocktails, I like the movie star which is ginger beer and champagne with a candied ginger garnish. I am definitely coming back to try their other deep dish pizzas. Kale app was amazing. 

Even though the place is small, it sucks that they have only one bathroom for females and males. Parking is street parking too. They have other locations so I may have to try the other locations.
author: Lena M.

description:
The Gluten Free / Celiac accommodations they made for me and my party were above and beyond. Everyone took our dietary restrictions seriously and I am grateful for that - esp at a pizza place! 

The service was great and portions beyond filling! We got two small pizzas for 3 hungry people and left with a doggy bag. Be sure to try their salads, as well.  

The GF thin crust pizza here is nice and crispy!
author: Maude B.

description:
I went on a Friday night - small restaurant and there was a wait, but got seated at the bar almost immediately. They have an old school juke box, which was a cute touch! 

We ordered the Burrata to start, then the BBQ chicken deep dish pizza. The burrata was amazing! And I have had many burrata appetizers around SF. There is about a 30 min wait for deep dish pizzas, but it was definitely worth the wait. Perfect ratio of crust to cheese to sauce/meat. The large size is pretty big and more than enough for 2 to share. Took some home in a doggy bag to eat later. I will definitely be returning for more deep dish pizza when I am in the area!
author: Rebecca Z.

description: We were in need of pizza and a bit turned around in the city. This place was the perfect stop. The cheese bread was cheesy, and the bbq chicken pizza on thin crust was delicious. I would recommend this place ten fold to anyone that wants a great pizza.
author: Courtney L.

description: Good ambiece great pizza and great service. I had the margerita pizza very good especially if you like garlic, lots of it!
author: Yolanda R.

description:
Everybody is SF knows of Little star and their AMAZING pizza . Everything on the menu is ON POINT . You can't just order one pizza ! Personally I always loved thin crust , but little star really changed my idea of deep dish . Their delicious flakey cornmeal crust , topped with tons of cheese , and the flavor was intense . Their pizza toppings are seriously a perfect harmony , they each compliment the pizza so well . Their spicy wings too , damn ! So . Good . They also have tons of beers to pair with the pizza . 

But unfortunately we got seated in the back even when we got called ahead and the floors were uneven so half of us kept rocking back and forth throughout the meal . We tried moving the table over just a tad so this could be solved , and even though it helped , the restaurant wouldn't allow it . The girl server also doesn't seem to be properly trained or just kinda socially awkward . She really didn't seem to understand what we were saying to her and was just kinda weird .
author: Carmen V.

description:
Oh Little Star how much do I love you! You have the best spicy chicken wings I've had in years and oh how I will long for them anytime I'm in the city. The smoky rub with spice in oven baked wings are to die for. If I were asked to have my last meal these wings would be part of my request.

The pizza was awesome and I wish I had enough courage to go after the deep dish! I made my own 3 topping with pepperoni, mushroom, and olive. We sat at the bar and our server Irena was absolutely the best. She was charming, patient, and attentive! She definitely enhanced our dining experience!

The interior decor is quaint and dark. Fortunately the bar has a television and local brews on tap (only 4). Wine and mixed drinks are available to order. Happy hour ran all night on a Monday so it's a good time to take advantage of the limited happy hour menu if you come in a little later in the evening. 

An order of wings and a small pizza with a couple drinks was perfect to share. I'm afraid if we went with the deep dish we wouldn't have been able to finish everything and ended up in a food coma! I do recommend getting the large and the deep dish if you want to take home some leftovers otherwise the small is good for two!
author: Shane T.

description:
3.5 stars. While the majority of patrons come here for their deep dish pizza, I tried one of their thin crust called WHITE PIE (garlic infused olive oil base, mozzarella, roasted zucchini, fresh tomatoes, feta, $26 for a large). The crust was a bit too hard to chew for my taste, and it probably didn't help that just one day before I had pizza at Il Casaro in North Beach. 

Our table also ordered deep dish (Classic, $26), I liked the rich flavor - but one piece and I'm done. 

I forgot to mention - fantastic garlic cheese bread as a starter. While Il Casaro remains my top spot for pizza in SF, Little Star is a great little place in the Divis corridor.
author: Sebastian F.

description: This pizza was awesome! We ordered a deep dish and added our own toppings. It took about 30 minutes for them to make the pizza, but it was worth it. The ingredients tasted and looked really fresh, the crust was soo delicious, and the sauce was robust and incredible. The restaurant itself is a little small, but it has a decent sized bar, a juke box and a little arcade game that you can play for free! The staff was friendly and welcoming. If I'm ever in the area again I'll make sure to stop here.
author: Cassidy M.

description: I ordered take-out and the pizza was great!  Loved it.  And although $31 is a lot for pizza...considering SF prices...this is very reasonable.  I'll go back for sure.
author: Jason M.

description:
Been trying to come to Little Star for the longest time because I heard that their deep dish pizza was massively impressive and I hadn't had any truly bomb deep dish since my forays into Chicago back in the day. Doesn't help that Little Star isn't exactly near any real parking, which was a serious deterrent from heading here. But having stayed at a friend's place nearby and noticing it was within easy walking distance, decision finally made to come through!

Kept it simple and ordered a Classic deep dish. Definitely some of the best deep dish pizza I've had. Giordano's does have me favoring a lot of cheese in my pie, but Little Star's deep dish has the perfect blend of cheese and sauce that puts it over the top (and kinda why I'm not as high on Zachary's as others are). Plus fresh cornmeal crust on any deep dish pizza is EASILY the best kind of crust you can have on this kinda pie.

Thoroughly enjoyed the pizza here, definitely glad I finally took the time to come here.
author: Alexander Y.

description:
Little Star Pizza...the stuff that my inner pizza lovin' fat kid's dreams are made of.

I have only had the Chicago style deep dish pizza and maybe it was because I ordered it in after a 12 hour shift, but it seriously rocked my world. We ordered a large half Little Star and half pepperoni and artichoke. 

The crust is thick, crumbly, and has a cornmeal like texture. Those stewed tomatoes are bursting with flavor. And the ooey gooey cheese...so good. 
Customer service is also pretty good. The second time I had Little Star, I ordered for pick up and they accidentally got only half my order correct. I didn't want to wait for them to make another pie so they offered me a discount or a gift card for my next visit. I took the discount and the manager gave me a little more than 50% off. 

And...I prefer it over the famous Tony's. There, I said it. 

Tip: There are two locations and the menu varies a bit (they offer a few signature pizzas/salads at one location but not the other) so double check the online menus when getting take out.
author: Miriam M.

description: This is compare and contrast review because while the pizza here is amazing I am comparing it to a sister type restaurant in the east bay, so therefore 4/5... you won't disappointed here btw, it's great Deep dish with good service just not the best in the bay!
author: Reg B.

description: Pretty good flavor and right amount of dough. I'm not a super thin crust type of person but neither am I a deep dish lover either. Their buffalo wings were tasty. Celery was crunchy. I mention this because there's not much worse than wilted, soggy, soft old celery.
author: Julie L.

description:
This was an AMAZING PLACE.
First of all it's not a touristy place. It wasn't easy to locate this place from simple view but when we found it, it was worth it. 
It was crowded. But we didn't wait much to get a table. Also noisy but it was a youthful ambiance. Got a few minutes to the waiter to bring us the menus but we were okay. 
Loved everything. We got a Mixed salad which was perfect for 3 persons. And also we got a Italian Combo Deep Dish Pizza. We got to wait a little but but the salad really entertained us. The pizza arrived and it was amazing! The ingredients were fresh and everything tasted super good. The pizza was enough also for 3 persons, we took 2 slices on a box. 
I dunno but I am definitely coming back next time I go to San Francisco because this is hell of a good place to meet locals and have a nice dinner!
author: Kari G.

description:
Best deep dish pizza I have had in a long time and I lived in Chicago. Rating based on bi-weekly delivery, so this does rating does not reflect the restaurant dining experience. 
 This is a thin crust deep dish crust, to be clear this does not mean that it is a light pizza. This is a rich golden crust has the perfect exterior crunch and touches of "cheese caramel". This is the best way to describe the bits of cheese that get toasted into the edges of the crust. We order the pepperoni and onion & the meatball and onion.
The meatball has a pile of herbed ricotta on top on each large slice. The cheese base is the perfect pull apart texture, with lots of cheese. The sauce has big chunks of juicy tomato's that add just the right amount of sweet and acidic and can cut through the cheese and rich crust. Meatballs are flavorful and savory. Delivery is consistently good, I have yet to be disappointed.
I also noticed they can cater to most dietary restictions
author: Bailey K.

description: I think..I don't get the American Pizza concept. It is almost like I am eating crackers sprinkled with some precut grocery items on top...then a massive cracker with tomato spread which is called the deep dish.. such an amazing concept to gain incredible calories with not much taste..
author: Arin K.

description: I knew this place would have great pizza. It's deep into the middle of the city. We built two pizzas of our own. One was pesto and mushrooms which was to die for.  The other was a traditional pepperoni, olive and mushroom. Red wine and pie one of my favs.
author: Josh G.

description:
This place was the bomb! We got on the wait list before we left the hotel and only had to wait 15 minutes after we hot there. The service was attentive and efficient.
The food definitely made this place though. We had a party of 4 and ordered a caprese salad and a mixed green salad to share with the table. They were outstanding!  And the there was the pizza. We ordered a Meateor pizza and a brussel sprout pizza. The meat pizza was awesome but the brussel sprout was a culinary experience. I'm not a fan of brussel sprouts but I would order this again.
author: William S.

description: I live in the neighborhood and I think they purposely leave their phone off the hook. I think that's weak as shit
author: Eshawn S.

description: Best deep dish in the city.  Fresh ingredients and cornmeal crust.  Would eat everyday if I could.
author: Jerry G.

description: The food is to die for - the best cuisine in San Francisco, if not in the Bay Area. Delicious! So, so unbelievably great, specially the deep dish dough. A few of the best pizza I have ever had around and a leading pizza place.
author: Rock T.

description:
Waited about 20 minutes for a table on a Monday night for four.

My friends and I shared the salad and the white deep dish pizza with red sauce on top. My sis doesn't eat meat so we had to sacrifice their meat pizza.

Anywho, the pizza was quite underwhelming. I never had deep dish but I'm all about carby, cheesy goodness. The crust on the pizza was really brittle yet super chewy, kind of in a bad way. The deep dish part of the pizza was just whatever. It felt like a lasagna on a bad pizza crust.

I was a bit disappointed in my first deep dish pizza experience. I doubt I will come here again when I'm visiting SF. Too many better places to try.
author: Cynthia J.

description:
Ordered pizza last night and took 3 hours to get here when told it would be here way sooner..
Pizza was cold!
And get this.. wasn't even the pizza I ordered!
Called and everyone including manager was rude as heck when I was just wanting pizza like seriously... didn't offer a refund or any compensation
Has 4 stars but idk about this place
author: Winona M.

description: Pretty good thick deep dish pizza. We've ordered a take out half Mediterranean (chicken) and half Little Star (spinach). All around for $26 w/taxes for 12" wheel of cornmeal dough. Remarkably good tomato sauce with noticeable chunks of diced tomatoes in it. High quality of the fresh ingredients and good cheese. The cornmeal crust wasn't all that heavy or greasy and appeared to be somewhat porous. Would I come back here again? Yep. But not sure if I'd want to stay in line for the experience. Only four stars for pricing, and lack of promotions, otherwise all good. BTW, the best deep dish I had so far was actually in Petaluma, CA.
author: Andy M.

description:
Don't read more reviews. Go in. Eat pizza. Drink a beer. And be happy. 

We went for a salad and a deep dish for four people after hitting he gym one day and it was perfect.
author: Max K.

description: Solid deepdish pizza. I found myself comparing it to chicago and that knocked off a star. Still one of the better deep dish pizzas avail in sf. But if you have been to malnattis in chiraq, this isn't better. Beats giordanos however. One 9" pizza is enough for 2 hungry people. If you go alone there will be leftovers.
author: Atif J.

description:
I ordered a large thin cheese pizza with double Kalamata olives. I ate the whole darn thing by myself. Pizza was excellent. Cooked to Perfection, and not mushy anywhere.

Restaurant was packed, but I was seated immediately. Dining room is nice, and bathroom is relatively clean. Service was good.

The only thing I would have liked to be different, fountain soda instead of canned Diet Coke.
author: scott h.

description:
As a lover of thin crust pizza, I must say I was almost converted after eating deep dish at Little Star! 

Ambiance: typical for most SF restaurants, this place was pretty small and the entryway definitely felt cramped while my group was waiting for a table. That being said, the actual dining area was spaced out well and I never felt cramped! 

Service: Very friendly staff! LOVE that you can order your deep dish ahead of time while waiting for a table. By the time our first appetizer had come out our deep dish was already on the table! 

Food: We ordered two appetizers to start-  the chicken wings and the garlic cheesy bread. Both were pretty standard, nothing too special. The pizza though was delicious! We were able to do half-half and ended up ordering the "White" and "Little Star". The pizza was well balanced, but the star was the crust - provided great texture in contrast to the cheese! We also ordered the warm brownie to share for dessert, but it was only so-so and I probably wouldn't get it again. 

Overall, my pizza craving was definitely satisfied and this is a great go-to place if you are a deep dish lover! Would love to come back and try their thin crust!
author: Alyssa P.

description:
Solid deep dish pizza on the west coast!

We ordered through DoorDash - the whole process was seamless. I know deep dish takes awhile to cook but even so, the order arrived in less than an hour.

We had the Classic deep dish. Great flavors, amazing tomatoes and a perfectly crispy and chewy deep dish cornmeal crust (all this even with delivery!). Soo filling!

The cheesecake for dessert was tasty too.

Can't wait to brave the waits and try their pizza in the restaurant.
author: Nathan L.

description:
Meal: Really early dinner on Saturday ~3PM
Style: Sit down
Food: Small deep dish little star

Overall would recommend.  Service was really good and the pizza was great.  Came with family - two kids, 4 and 6.  Got there right when it opened.  Water provided right away without even asking.  Kids were given their own kids' cups.  Limited menu in terms of appetizers and drinks for the kids, but pizza was plenty of food so would recommend going straight for the pizza and skip an appetizer.  Atmosphere was a little cold and dark, but good overall.
author: Jeff H.

description: Seriously delicious deep dish pizza.  Their crust is amazing.  I am thrilled to have also found a great tasting vegan pizza here, have had it for a second time and many more to come.  Delicious, try it.
author: Peter V.

description: We absolutely love this place , great service and great quality pizza , I drive all the way from Sacramento , my cousin flew in from back east and I said I'm taking you to little star, best pizza in the city I love this place and you will also u promise you
author: Koach S.

description: A good local place away from the touristy stuff, but still close to the painted ladies.  Super filling deep dish pizza that tastes super fresh.  Place doesn't look so inviting from the outside, but glad some locals tipped me off.
author: Mark L.

description: I hate deep dish. Although me and my bf always order it. I always eat cheese pizza therefore I believe I give the most accurate review. Because my taste is solely based off the sauce, cheese and bread/crust? It was so good. I enjoyed it. My boyfriend order some meatball junk but unfortunately his food was wrong and ended up with the Chicken BBQ. WELL. he wasn't a huge fan. Which I'm not surprised it's BBQ all are not created equally. They later gave us half off of next visit. That's some crazy shit! Next visit are you kidding me?  It should have be half off today so there will be a next visit. But I guess. Smoked wings are good here also. And so was the garlic bread. Not sure if my bf wants to come back and give it another chance. But because the experience didn't match the food I couldn't higher rating. Also another thing when the experience doesn't match the food it takes away from telling others about the place or tipping more than 15%
author: Alex L.

description:
underwear!
iron man!
underwear!
"sincere" is when you really mean it
"insincere" is when ydgaf
underwear!
(and more nonstop underwear...)

this was my dinner at Little Star. "Little" as in a whopping 7 tables had kids, with convos to match.

but you know what? if this is sf's robotless skeeballless version of chuck e cheese, i feel hopeful for our future hipsters of trumpmerica.

because this place is cool.
(read: you had me at semialt lifestyle whtchx servers)

(^_^) Spicy Chicken Wings $9HH/$12SH (http://bit.ly/2fGYwL3)
good spicy not cray spicy
1 pound of chicken! #twss

(^_^) Los Pollo Hermano $27 (http://bit.ly/2fCroBx)
get Large Deep Dish ffff anything else
meat was a little tough tho #twss

next time i might throw on the jukebox, see if i can drown out some adjacent talk. does the juke have busta rhymes? just tell me it doesn't have a song about ffffin underwear...
author: Dan B.

description: Love the food but location is soso. Lighting is a bit dark. Garlic bread was so good and everything came out so hot. Only regret is wish I could of tried everything on the menu.
author: Celeste S.

description: I may have hit on a less than stellar night. Food and service were still good. But it lacked it's usual stellar experience. They still get five stars but I'm watching you.
author: david b.

description: The deep Dish pizza is really good. Atmosphere is basic but pleasant and serves it purpose. Waiting staff was very nice and the hostess especially . My only complaint is about the Roasted Kale & Parm Salad... it tasted ok but the serving size was very small and should be more of a " tasting " size or maybe even a table sample bowl.
author: Terrance G.

description: Come to this gem all the time when I am in the city. The food is amazing. Makes you wonder why you even cheat yourself and order take out chain pizza. I love everything from the food to the ambiance. The service is always a perfect 10 and the food never fails. We usually show up for happy hour which is totally worth it and over stuff ourselves on some delish pizza and always take a order to go plus leftovers. You can never go wrong with the Margherita Plus or the Little Star Pizza. Please note if they are busy it is loud. That's part of the fun having to use your not inside voice to have a conversation. Please check this place out as you won't be disappointed.
author: Nat D.

description:
First time trying deep dish pizza and WOW! 
Customer service was beyond excellent, we were very well attended to and loved the service. 
We ordered :
garlic bread; scrumptious, mini pizza look a like, with cheese my garlic. 
Wings; were ok, wish they had a sauce. 
Deep dish; pepperoni with sausage, so delicious!

We will most definitely we back soon!
author: Gabriela G.

description: I love Little Star! The thin crust and deep dish pizzas are equally delicious, and they're very accommodating about customizing the toppings or doing half and half. Pro tip: go after work on Monday or Tuesday to enjoy happy hour ( $4-5 beers and wines) all the way up to 9:30 PM.
author: Sara F.

description: Good pizza with a verity of choices in a friendly place. Once set on a wet chair, got a free appetizer (was delicious!)
author: Gali S.

description: Love this place. Got a large deep dish pizza delivered. It was expensive, but well worth it. Honestly some of the best pizza I've ever had and I usually prefer thin crust!
author: Charlotte H.

description: Garlic bread is so bomb! We ordered takeout and it was ready really quickly & the staff was really helpful (since we had never been there before). Highly recommend!
author: Emma L.

description: This place has Amazing Deep Dish and great service in a no frills environment. A must try!!
author: Sarah K.

description:
Let me start by saying I'm from Los Angeles! Ok, they have Sm & Lg size Small thin is about 8 slices, small deep dish serves 6 slices. 
They offer specialty pizzas, already topped with a set price. Or you can select SM cheese ($13) and add additional toppings priced accordingly. 
We ordered build your own: 
One thin cheese add of pepperoni. So thin crispy light but generous amount of sauce. If heaven were a place on earth biting in to this pizza is it! Or so I thought 
Until for the very first time I bit into a Deep Dish pizza the crust ugh! Who knew corn meal would be such a primary component the taste of the deep dish while grease and calorie packed it's well worth what you're biting into. 
We split our BYO cheese deep dish($14) in half:
1/2 pepperoni 
1/2 Sausage, Salami, + bell pepper.  
Hot damn, so crispy and carb& & & flavor loaded pizza it's like a pie except the crust isn't the best part the whole pie is!! 

We were lucky enough to find a metered parking across the street. One restroom clean. 

Around 6 walked in it wasn't busy but it quickly got busy after the half!  

Service was good considering it's a pizza joint so not uber necessary but we were ecstatic. So satisfied we took an additional thin crust pizza to go w/ our left overs. And even a day late it's GOOD.
author: Tiffany D.

description: This pizza has made west coast pizza haters (east coasters) say 'well done'... one of my favorite deep dish pizza spots, eat in or pick up its solid. Cornmeal crust is on another level, and no pops for the 8th time it's not cornbread crust & why did you not show us such things growing up!!??
author: John O.

description: If you like deep dish pizza this is the place to go in San Francisco. Fresh ingredients. Only objection is the wait staff can be moody if not surly but the food ends up making it worthwhile.
author: May B W.

description: OMG best deep dish I have eaten!  Liked the atmosphere enjoyed the service all for a decent price.  Will definitely return when in San Francisco.
author: Ed C.

description:
Not usually a huge deep dish fan but I was told I had to try the deep dish here sooo it happened. Definitely good pizza, but I tend to put deep dish in a different category then regular pizza. Deep dish to me is more like lasagna, not that there is anything wrong with that but it isn't exactly pizza in my book. 

I ordered the vegetarian small pizza, along with the chopped salad to start and a bottle of wine (don't worry I wasn't by myself). Everything was very tasty!

Great little spot. I'd be interested to come back and try the thin crust pizza too.
author: Ilana B.

description:
Their rock solid Little Star deep dish pizza is so good that when I flew to San Francisco this spring from the Caribbean, it was on my definitely need to have list. I added sausage to my pizza this past trip. I put the leftovers in the refrigerator for the night and ate the rest for breakfast, cold. 

It's just that good.
author: Eric J.

description: Great deep dish and I'm a New York style thin crust gal.  My new fave pizza spot. Check it out !
author: Elle K.

description: Dare I say this is the best pizza in SF? IMO.  Best Little Star location, too. Parking can be hard to find, but it's so worth it! I'll circle for a half an hour, just for a simple deep dish cheese! So flavorful and such a delight. A weekly splurge (for now!).
author: Michelle D.

description: I was looking for a good brunch on yelp after a strenuous hike. Being a vegetarian, its always a time consuming search for me. And God bless yelp that i came across this place. We(3) ordered one large thin crust and a medium deep dish pizza. Our thin crust was a custom pizza with cheery picked toppings and we liked it more. Deep dish is their specialty and was pretty good as well. Unfortunately I don't have a pic as we were starving and couldn't resist any minute on seeing the pizza. Must visit for vegetarians.
author: Shruti C.

description:
Came here for a first date dinner - honestly, not a big fan of deep dish.
The pizza crusts here kinda reminded me of pie crusts - a little too crusty and pretty heavy.

Luckily I was pretty buzzed and had some munchies after a nice j, the experience here was not bad. Just, I wouldn't go back here for pizza :( Ambience is alright, and I'm sure they have other types of pizza that was good but this place is not for me.
author: David Y.

description: Possibly the best pizza I've ever had. Buttery thin crust. Excellent.  Service was great. They really went out of their way to accommodate our large party.   We'll be back.
author: Dolly R.

description: Tried this place based on Yelp reviews and  were they right-- the Little Star deep dish pizza was awesome and well worth the wait. Sat at the bar, service was great. Next time we are in San Francisco,  wouldn't hesitate to come back!
author: Michele T.

description: pizza was like back in Chicago. the salad was also very good. Blair was our server and very nice and helpful when we asked for directions.
author: Michael P.

description: Perfect large menu selections and variety of tastes. Service was similarly excellent and friendly.
author: Victoria F.

description: We ordered a custom Chicago style deep dish and the kale appetizer.  The kale salad was perfect.  I'm a thin crust pizza lover myself but this pizza was incredible. Not too filling and the crust was a well balanced sweet and savory.  The staff are friendly and quite attentive.  We arrived close to their closing time but the place was still packed and they didn't rush anyone out.
author: Stacey M.

description: Pizza was absolutely delicious (thin crust)! We ordered too much though, they were larger than expected. The online wait check in was very handy. Service was friendly and we got our pizzas quickly.
author: Debbie v.

description:
I always thought I didn't like deep dish, but turns out I like deep dish pizza here! Well, by now, I'm used to being wrong about everything. 
I put aside my preconceived notions about deep dish, because at the time, I was too hungry to care. There were a few people waiting outside, but luckily a couple vacated the table behind the jukebox, so we were seated pretty quickly. There's a narrow row of small of tables opposite a bar and next to the bar, there are a couple of mismatched couches. It actually kind of worked and was a good use of the space.

$20.50 Little Star - spinach blended with ricotta & feta, mushrooms, onions, garlic, 
+ $2.10 sausage: Very, very good!
In the past, I thought all deep dish pizzas had soggy, limp crusts under an overwhelming amount of tart, tomato sauce. Neither wet crust nor a mouthful of sauce appeals to me.
However, the cornmeal crust on this deep dish pizza is delightfully crunchy and substantially thick enough to support the weight of the filling. 
Instead of a heavy tomato sauce, the interior was stuffed with spinach and mushrooms. There was so much spinach that I think they must have sautéed and wilted down the leaves first before mixing it into the creamy ricotta & feta. 
Also, it was so incredibly cheesy that the gooey strings just kept on stretching. 
Since the tomato sauce sits on top of the cheesy filling, the crust does not absorb the moisture from the sauce. The order of the toppings must be the reason why their pizzas come out solid and crunchy instead of wet and soggy.

$12.50 Spicy Chicken Wings - pound of wings with baby carrots and blue cheese dressing:
These wings seemed to be baked with a spice rub, as opposed to fried. The result is considerably less messy than most chicken wings. It had quite a bit of heat and spicy kick to it, which I attempted to quell with the baby carrots. I didn't use too much of the blue cheese dressing since the flavor is too sharp for my preferences.
